page.title: 01OVERVIEW DARENTH VALLEY
page.content: The area defined by the block consists largely of arable farmland: open fields enclose some scattered patches of woodland. Chalk is quarried at Pinden End Farm. Besides individual farms, there are 3 main areas of settlement. To the West, located in the{Darent Valley,}and built along the R.Darent, lie the villages of{Horton } {Kirby and South Darenth.}In the latter, new light industry now occupies the buildings of the old paper mill. Longfield, to the East, is connected with South Darenth by the railway line from London to Dover. The railway, which bisects the block from east to west, crosses the river at S. Darenth on a brick viaduct completed in 1860. The other main line of communication is the B260 road, passing N.W. through Longfield towards Dartford.
